question: Which of the following events is not correct?
explanation:
Simon commission arrived in British India in 1927-28 to study constitutional reform.  The Gandhi-Irwin Pact was a political agreement signed by Mahatma Gandhi and Lord Irwin on 5 March 1931 .The Salt Satyagraha took place in 1930.
The Quit India Movement, or the August Movement, was a movement launched at the Bombay session of the All-India Congress Committee by Mahatma Gandhi on 8 August 1942.
